text: Thanks for the feedback, Evelynn! I did go with a custom object, and I think that is going to work!

Does anyone know if it's possible to make CRM standard and custom objects appear on a Membership page, but the records that display are specific to the associated contact? For example, we have a custom object called "Inspection Data," and we want users who are logged into the membership site to see Inspection Data records associated with their company. So an employee from Company A who's logged into the website can only see Company A's Inspection Data, but they cannot see Company B's inspection data.

Hopefully that makes sense.... thanks, everyone!

yes, definitely. Itâ€™s exactly the kind of thing membership pages are meant for. You could just use the {{contact}} variable, which will give you the ID, among a variety of other properties.

There are a few ways to go about retrieving the associated data - the most appropriate likely being the hubl, crm_associations() function. You can read more about its use via the link.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions>
and just to clarify, the contact variable should be readily accessible on any membership page by default. No variable declaration necessary.
Awesome! Thanks for the feedback, Niko :raised_hands:
